sections.title: I. Introduction
sections.content: The purpose of this policy document is to define the expectations, responsibilities, and code of conduct for all personnel associated with Adani Group, including employees, interns, contractors, administrators, and managers across all departments. This serves as a living guideline to foster professionalism, productivity, and integrity.

sections.title: II. Code of Conduct
content: Uphold the values of integrity, transparency, and sustainability
Maintain professionalism in behavior, communication, and attire
Respect company property, colleagues, and workplace ethics
Avoid any form of discrimination, harassment, or unfair treatment
Immediately report unethical practices or violations to the Ethics Committee

sections.title: III. Working Hours and Attendance
content: Standard working hours: 9:30 AM ‚Äì 6:30 PM (Monday to Friday)
Flexible timings permitted on managerial approval
Biometric attendance mandatory
Work-from-home requests subject to department head approval

subsections.title: Admin Staff
content: Maintain facility infrastructure and office supplies
Coordinate with vendors and contractors
Ensure safety compliance and access control
Supervise housekeeping, security, and logistics

subsections.title: Contractors
content: Execute assigned tasks as per scope of work and deadlines
Report daily work status to assigned supervisor
Use temporary access passes
Comply with safety and security regulations

subsections.title: Interns
content: Work under close mentorship and guidance
Submit weekly learning and contribution reports
Attend mandatory training sessions
Access limited to learning resources and internal tools

subsections.title: Managers
content: Lead team performance reviews and project tracking
Approve leaves, budgets, and escalation matters
Conduct meetings, delegate tasks, and monitor KPIs
Act as point of contact between leadership and team

general: Maintain monthly and quarterly sales targets
Record and report sales data accurately in the CRM
Participate in product training and client acquisition plans

roles.Manager: Analyze regional performance, manage leads, strategize outreach
roles.Intern: Assist in research, cold calls, and lead generation
roles.Contractor: Execute sales campaigns on a contract basis

general: Handle recruitment, onboarding, payroll, and grievances
Maintain employee records and performance reviews
Conduct training, wellness, and engagement programs

roles.Manager: Oversee policies, manage appraisals, and conflict resolution
roles.Intern: Support documentation, candidate tracking, and event coordination
roles.Contractor: Temporary support in hiring drives and documentation

general: Maintain IT infrastructure, network, and software support
Secure data access, backups, and monitor system health

roles.Manager: Lead security protocols, software rollouts, and system upgrades
roles.Intern: Assist with helpdesk, testing, and tech documentation
roles.Contractor: Engage in installation, hardware setup, and software deployment

sections.title: VI. Leave Policy
content: Annual Leave: 20 working days
Casual Leave: 10 days
Sick Leave: 12 days
Interns & Contractors: Pro-rated leave as per contract
All leave requests must be routed via HRMS and approved by line managers

sections.title: VII. Data Privacy and Security
content: Confidentiality must be maintained for all internal and client data
Sharing passwords, unauthorized software, or removable media is prohibited
All devices must be password-protected and updated with the latest security patches
IT team reserves rights to audit systems and revoke access on violations

sections.title: VIII. Dress Code
content: Smart formal or business casuals from Monday to Thursday
Friday is business casuals or company merchandise day
Site visits require PPE gear as per safety standards

sections.title: IX. Compliance and Disciplinary Action
content: Failure to adhere to the above policies will result in warnings, suspension, or termination depending on the severity of the breach
Disciplinary committee will conduct a fair investigation before decision

sections.title: X. Acknowledgment
sections.content: All personnel are required to sign a digital acknowledgment form confirming they have read, understood, and agreed to comply with the company policies.
